Name: Baku
Description: The capital and largest city of Azerbaijan, located on the Caspian Sea, known for its modern architecture and rich cultural history.

Name: Ganja
Description: A major city in western Azerbaijan, known for its historical landmarks and as a cultural and industrial center.

Name: Mingachevir
Description: A city located on the Kura River, known for its large hydroelectric power plant and industrial significance.

Name: Lankaran
Description: A city located near the Caspian Sea, known for its mild climate, tea plantations, and natural beauty.

Name: Sumgayit
Description: An industrial city near Baku, known for its chemical and manufacturing industries.

Name: Shirvan
Description: A city in central Azerbaijan, known for its agricultural production and historical sites.

Name: Barda
Description: A town in the central part of Azerbaijan, historically known as the site of an ancient settlement.

Name: Guba
Description: A city in northeastern Azerbaijan, known for its scenic beauty, historic sites, and agricultural products.

Name: Tovuz
Description: A region located in the western part of Azerbaijan, known for its agricultural production, including wine and fruit.

Name: Khachmaz
Description: A region located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan, known for its agriculture and historical sites.

Name: Zagatala
Description: A region in the northwestern part of Azerbaijan, known for its mountainous terrain, scenic beauty, and historical significance.
